Reviews.Title: “Good Airport stopover”
Reviews.Author: gcr23
Reviews.Content: Stayed here on arrival at Madrid airport and on return after trip to Murcia. Good, clean hotel. The shuttle from the airport was easy, just phone them by the car rentals and they collect you, then you book your shuttle to the airport for the next day. Breakfast good but bar snack portions were very small, and probably microwaved - not great. A bit far from Madrid city centre but ideal for airport stay.

Reviews.Title: “As airport hotels go this was good”
Reviews.Author: FamilyoffiveEssexUK
Reviews.Content: We stayed on two different evenings at the start and end of our holiday in Spain. We were two adults and two teenage children. The prices for the room including the shuttle and the breakfast were very very competitive. The first night was not as good as the second but that was probably because we arrived late and everyone was very tired. Breakfast was excellent Dinner in the evening was good in the retardant if a little expensive. The bar snacks looked use as good and not quite as pricey. Room as veryp good. Shuttle excelllent but make sure you email in advance any times to get your name on the list

Reviews.Title: “Clean and comfortable, but that's it”
Reviews.Author: ABHT
Reviews.Content: We stayed here our last night in Spain since it has a free airport shuttle. Our room was very clean and comfortable, with a nice bathroom and comfy beds. Front desk staff was ok during check in--not very welcoming, but not unfriendly. However, the cafetria and restaurant staff person was unhappy and rude for no apparent reason (we were friendly and low maintenance). As soon as we sat down he acted like our presence was an imposition--he was curt, forgot to bring parts of our order, and generally made us feel quite unwelcome. He served us on two different occasions and was the same during both. Also of note for travelers--the shuttle only has eight seats and goes once per hour, so get your reservation in early. We ended up getting our third time choice, meaning we got to the airport four hours before our departure. And, there is nothing near the hotel--if you don't have a car, you're stuck with the bad restaurant staff and mediocre food, or paying for a taxi that would need to be called. I was very disappointed--I expected more from a Crowne Plaza.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable room, not more”
Reviews.Author: iophir
Reviews.Content: It all starts at the airport. There is no regular shuttle waiting, or even a sign/tall free phone to call them. Just take a taxi. Once in the hotel, the level of service is nothing like in any other CP in the world. Staff is OK, but without even a smile... Rooms were comfortable excellent bed and shower. Location is right on an highway with not many activities/bars/restaurants around so just get a good night sleep. When you need to leave back to the airport, again, don't count on the shuttle.

Reviews.Title: “Best place I stayed in”
Reviews.Author: LGW_1210
Reviews.Content: Crowne Plaza was a fantastic experience. We stayed one night as we were flying back to India early the next morning and everything was as promised. The room was rather spacious with all the amenities one would generally require and a free minibar as well. The beds too were extremely comfortable. The wi-fi was satisfactory in the room as well and it was one of the few places the staff spoke excellent English. The shuttle bus left bang on time and got us to the airport ahead of schedule. We got in late on a Sunday night and Octavian was the person on duty at the reception and Sergio was handling the luggage etc. Both were extremely helpful and helped us weigh our bags which was a primary concern at the time. The only complaint I have is the lack of any English channels on the television but that seems to be the case all over Spain. Overall, great experience and I would most definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Unreliable shuttle bus!”
Reviews.Author: Relajaso
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel! But boy, don´t trust the half an hour shuttle they promise! Take a taxi or prepare to wait! It´s not that close to the airport either..........

Reviews.Title: “best Hotel I stayed so far in Spain”
Reviews.Author: fifo667
Reviews.Content: I went there when Barcelona played against Bayern and I was almost late for the match, so I asked to check me in quick and expected not much but hey hey...fantastic room, nice and clean and spacey. I then ordered some wine and some apetizers...you know fingerfood things....again fantastic quality. Next morning the breakfast was kind of average but the Gym was really nice...all in all and considering that the Spanish are no breakfast champions this Hotel is a clear keeper. It is kind of far away from the city but they offer a shuttle to the airport and from there you can get into Madrid quite easy. If you are a buisness traveller like I am...this Hotel will satisfy your expectations

Reviews.Title: “An airport hotel”
Reviews.Author: MissTjia
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for one night as we were catching an early flight to barcelona the next day. The room is nice, appropriate size, and bathroom is nice too. In the room they provide with a coffee machine but no tea. If you are a tea lover, you have to buy at the restaurant for tea but the minibar is for free (just a few soft drink and a beer). My problem with the room is that we could hear the music that they played in the lobby. However, I think at around 10pm, they turn it off, so we didnt go to the receptionist to complaint. This hotel is far from every where, so not good for tourist as the main attraction in Madrid is in the city. Since it was raining, we had to order a room service from the restaurant. Nothing special but it's OK. The bus is also quite a bit of walk from the hotel. However, the hotel provide a free shuttle bus to and from the airport, but please dont forget to book in advance. From the airport to this hotel also takes about 15-20 minutes. And when you arrive at the airport, you need to call the hotel to come and pick you up, otherwise you will be waiting for ages for the shuttle bus. No wifi provided unless you are in the lobby. They have gym for free, not huge but it's there. i would recommend this hotel who is on business trip and has to catch up an early flight.

Reviews.Title: “Ottimo”
Reviews.Author: Gnagnetti
Reviews.Content: It's a perfect hotel if you want to stay close to the airport. The rooms are nice, clean and quiet. Hardwood floor, Everything just perfect! The only thing not exciting is the breakfast which is ..... not the best possible. It has also a shuttle service to go to the airport running every 1/2 hr Free parking, free wifi. Fresh fruit for Platinum PC memebers I would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Staff let the hotel down - rooms immaculate.”
Reviews.Author: Dean R
Reviews.Content: I got an excellent deal on what was a very luxurious room and bathroom. However, on entering the hotel, none of the staff on reception said hello, and I certainly wouldn't say they offered a friendly welcome. When I was looking for somewhere to eat I was told that there was nowhere nearby. I walked 2 minutes down the road and found a very nice restaurant. Having said this, the room was very quiet, clean, and very well finished. Very comfortable beds. Don't get a taxi from the airport though, as it cost me 28 euros. It seemed a little difficult to track down a bus, but will be worth saving the money, as it's only a couple of miles away.

Reviews.Title: “Nice enough for a business stay”
Reviews.Author: aaronwileman
Reviews.Content: This is a nice hotel by business stay standards, particularly if you are staying out of the city of Madrid and close to the airport. Just try and ring in advance for the shuttle, as I waited 45 mins for the shuttle to arrive and didnt get to the hotel until around 1am. So wish I had known that before. The staff were great, able to help with various things I needed, although the wireless didnt work, but they got around that by giving you a free cable to use while you stay, which in effect is faster anyway.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: PrincePolo
Reviews.Content: I called the hotel after exiting terminal 2 at Madrid’s Barajs airport to request a pick up and a hotel shuttle arrived in 5 minutes. The hotel is just 10 minutes away. My room had a slick contemporary décor, including a hardwood floor. Amenities included a free bottle of water and espresso machine. I was quite keen on having an espresso but after several attempts the machine failed produce anything. Its operation did not seem intuitive to me and the instructions were in Spanish only. I am not sure whether it was broken or I didn’t know how to use it. I mentioned this when I checked out and they promised to check the machine. The soundproofing of the room was excellent. I could see aircraft overflying the hotel at a low altitude but could not hear a thing. WiFi was free but – unfortunately – was available only in the lobby and bar. I had a very reasonably priced glass of wine in the bar while checking my email. In a contrast with the rooms the bar is faceless. Breakfast was adequate but I would not write home about it. All together it was an enjoyable stay and I would happily stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Call for the shuttle”
Reviews.Author: seventynine
Reviews.Content: I chose this hotel because of the price and because of the brand. It's an excellent value. I paid 56 euros, taxes inculded for a double room. The staff was very welcoming and did his job perfectly. I just used this hotel as an overnight stay. What you have to know, is that you have to call the hotel for the shuttle when you're at the airport. I thought they would dirve on a regular basis around the airport's terminal, but I waited for 30 minutes and decided to make a call. 10 minutes later th shuttle was here, and 5 minutes later, I was at the hotel. On the morning, We left the hotel at 5.30 am, and were at the ariport at 5.35 am. Great service. The room and bathroom were excellent. The bed was very comfortable, the bathroom well apointed, and th minibar free, which is just two bottle of water, a can of coke, and a can of tonic water, nada mas! The hotel is in a quiet place, so no noise from outside to be heard inside. All in all a great value for this airport hotel (I would never use this hotel to visit Madrid)

Reviews.Title: “Pay a little more for a better hotel”
Reviews.Author: Alexia
Reviews.Content: Chose this on location and price but in hindsight would prefer to stay at another hotel. We chose the hotel as most people do, for proximity to the airport. One reviewer mentioned it was difficult to find. Living in Spain, I thought, "Oh, that won´t happen to us". Well they were absoutely right. The directions were terrible and it took us a long time to locate. We arrived at 10pm. The children were hungry and the restaurant was closed. Breakfast was a shambles with no tea or coffee out so people were queuing at the kitchen door to catch staff for a cup of coffee. Be sure to book your transport to the airport at reception and not over the phone. When we were scheduled to get the bus, they told us they did not have our booking and the bus was full. They seemed to have no record of our call. On the plus side, they eventually called and paid for a taxi to take us to the airport. It all turned out OK: we finally got some coffee at breakfast and got to the airport but would not stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “dissapointed by the staff....”
Reviews.Author: nishiii
Reviews.Content: Crown Plaza a big brand and is present aross the globe, i must say the service was very very dissapointing. i had landed in madrid on th the 3rd and we were off the valencia from there. as we were flying out from MAdrid only, we chose to see it in the end. For tourist's its not a ideal deal, its far from the city and might take 25 euros from taxi one way, so you should give it a thought. its clean, well appointed rooms and good breakfast. There isa coffee maker in the room as well (if this is a delight to people). The problem they have is, and where the hotel lost its touch is about the staff at the reception. They are the only and the most arrogant people in entire spain. i am glad the two weeks trip of ours washed the first impession we got after talking to the reception staff. They may speak english, but they are not helpful, they would be rude and pretend to be busy and not stick by the words they would say. Basic info like resturant nearby, best way to travel, sayin hi, a smile on the face..all missing.... You are definatly a big no for me forever. hope you get things right at your end.

Reviews.Title: “An excellent stopover”
Reviews.Author: chrisdrew
Reviews.Content: We needed an overnight stop in Madrid between flights and this hotel was superb. It is about 15 or 20 minutes from the airport - but the shuttle bus responds very quickly to telephone requests (all the hotel shuttle bus telephone numbers are posted on a notice at the bus stop: remember to add the Spanish country code (+34)!). I suspect a taxi would be very expensive. An enormous room: comfortable beds; absolutely quiet, despite being under the landing path for the airport. The restaurant was disappointing - limited choice and surly service - but the bar was friendly with a choice of beers and reasonable prices. We did not want a full meal - only a post-travel snack. In future we would eat at the Holiday Inn Express, which is immediately across the road from the Crowne Plaza

Reviews.Title: “Great palce for a layover....”
Reviews.Author: fglawihio
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Crown Plaza airport Madrid April 2012. We found the hotel to be very clean and modern. We checked in at midnight for a 10 a.m. flight. We arrived at 12:00 a.m. and were in our room in fifteen minutes. Parking is 7 euros per day. The hotel staff speaks english and were friendly to deal with. rember as in most hotels in eourpe you must put your room key into the slot near the door for the lights to work. By the way the price was as good or better than other "budget" hotels near by. It's a ten minute drive to the airport if you have a car. Keep in mind all rental cars at the Madrid airport are returned to the P-1 parking lot. Liam & Colleen New York

Reviews.Title: “Great Room”
Reviews.Author: Josesampaio
Reviews.Content: Great room with plenty of space and free coffe machine! Well located near the Barajas airport! Poor staff in the loby!

Reviews.Title: “Not central but ideal for touring”
Reviews.Author: Snookoafc1
Reviews.Content: I have visited this location - and reviewed it before. It was interesting to come back a year later and see how it has evolved. The Crowne Plaza is in the same group of InterContinentals and Holiday Inns (there's a Holiday Inn Express across the road) and is well up to standard for this more upmarket brand within the group. It is close to the airport, in fact it is on the flight-path, and the hotel has a mini-bus which will pick you up if you call. The mini-bus will also go to and from the nearby IFEMA exhibition complex for those there on business. But I view this as an excellent stop-over point for touring Spain. You don't have the agony of fighting your way through the streets of Madrid where the drivers take no prisoners, especially if you have foreign plates. The hotel has excellent, large rooms, very comfortable and (joy!) free internet. The food is a little basic, as it assumes that most guests will eat out (probably right), but the staff are delightfully helpful and friendly. The rooms even have coffee machines, which is impressive, but no help if you are a tea-drinker, especially with those mini-cups. There is a gym, underground parking, plenty of TV channels and even daily 'newspapers' from your own country in your own language. The hotel has maintained the standards of a year ago and remains my number one choice if in the Madrid area - and I don't need the city centre.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent price for a quality stay”
Reviews.Author: Bul
Reviews.Content: Although I spent only one night here , the cleanness and moderness of the rooms, the friendliness of the staff and the price convinced me to stay again, if I wanted to come for vacation. For business purposes it would have been better , if it had good wireless reception also in the rooms. The strength of the signal was so weak that I could not continue working.

Reviews.Title: “New Hotel, Nice Rooms, Very Good Service....No WiFi in Room...No Restaurants Near”
Reviews.Author: ScottB68
Reviews.Content: New hotel near Madrid Barajas Airport......Service was very good and personable....Rooms were nice with comfortable bed and hardwood floors, nice bathroom. All in all a very good facility... It is near the airport and off of a main freeway but is located in an industrial area, no restaurants or clubs nearby. Also, make sure you find this place on your GPS and load it in....you'll pass it on the main freeway but will have a heck of a time trying to exit and actually enter the parking lot.....stick to the service road. For the price, I recommend the Crown Plaza Madrid for an overnight stay if you're flying in / out. Don't stay if you're looking for a tourist location.

Reviews.Title: “Great for overnight stay near airport”
Reviews.Author: 14bosley
Reviews.Content: Newer hotel, very clean, bright and modern with warm relaxing color scheme. Very few people here, perhaps because there are no facilities nearby. It is located in an area that appears to have been planned to be a hotel, restaurant, shop area near airport but none of this has happened. A couple of other hotels nearby but may not be open. Roads have been left half built and several buildings that may have been hotels have been left half constructed- sad really. This hotel has a decent restaurant perhaps a little expensive. parking has a 7euro charge (underground). A odeern Seiko espresso machine in our room did not work- they gave us a breakfast as an apology- very ccnsiderate of them. Wifi is available in lobby and restaurant area but only hard line in rooms. No computer desk areas. You must send your boarding pass info to main desk to have them print it out- awkward. Otherwise we enjoyed our quiet stay there.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel cconsidering the price”
Reviews.Author: domnl
Reviews.Content: This is a new hotel and it shows. Everything still looking great, well appointed rooms, good bathroom. Relatively hard mattresses though. Bar closes at 2300; a bt early. When you want to use the shuttle you have to call in advance, it is not always available, it doesnt run on schedule, only on demand! That is something for the management to see to!

Reviews.Title: “Don't go for the airport shuttle service”
Reviews.Author: Mariessister
Reviews.Content: Had to wait 2 hours in the blistering sun, Only 1 shuttle and the service sucks !!!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel, not for the Madrid tourist”
Reviews.Author: Sagrr A
Reviews.Content: The hotel was excellent, great living standards, very plush and gorgeous rooms. Hotel gives free shuttles to and from airport. Connectivity to city is not easy for the first timer, however I must mention buses are fairly frequent and barely 20 mins away from a main train/bus station, very cheap and very helpful bus drivers. Unfortunately I did not know Spanish and the hotel kitchen staff (could not speak English) / front desk (could speak fluently) were unhelpful when I was trying to order room service. I was trying to get through and was put on hold for several minutes, the whole ordeal lasted about half hour. In the end, I just went to the restaurant opposite this one and brought back a meal.

Reviews.Title: “Great room / poor service”
Reviews.Author: Manos P
Reviews.Content: Excellent room / bed, very poor taste and even poorer service! Buy food from airport before going to the hotel. Also never got the wake-up call that i had asked!! :-(

Reviews.Title: “No wifi in room.stay away”
Reviews.Author: lucky88
Reviews.Content: If you want just a bed,this ok is great since the bed itself is terrific. But if you need to do any work and need wifi then away. How can any hotel that purports to be 4* especially since it was recently renovated. Although there is supposed to be wifi in reception, it is very unstable. Furthermore there are no decent chairs or tables in reception and there are no power outlets in sight. The hotel seems to think that having a fancy espresso machine in the room and "free" minibar (which is 2 bottles of water and 3 soft drinks!). I like the hotels policy on sleep and quiet zones. But it's not enough when i want to be connected.

Reviews.Title: “Cold, but nice”
Reviews.Author: Cali_rose55
Reviews.Content: I chose this hotel for the short distance, approximately 12 minutes, to the airport. They provide a shuttle service, which was friendly and prompt, even at 4:30am. The room was on the cold, minimalistic, glass and metal side, but the bed was great and the room was large, even for American standards. There are no restaurants or stores nearby, just the highway, which I could not hear at all. It's roughly a 20-25 minute taxi ride from the Madrid Chamartin train station, about 20 euros. Great for overnight to airport stay.

Reviews.Title: “useless airport hotel”
Reviews.Author: numberoneson
Reviews.Content: shuttle that operates on 1.5 hour intervals? in the middle of nowhere, fairly far from the airport the rooms were nice and service decent but you would be much better off in a more convenient location with a frequent shuttle

Reviews.Title: “"Rude Staff" NO "WIFI"”
Reviews.Author: No7Agency
Reviews.Content: Crowne plaza madrid - near airport Just spent one night at CP Madrid On arrival the CP courtesy bus was parked outside Hotel looked very nice & new. The reception is both bright & modern and looks very new. At reception explained that I was PLAT AMB and enquired if there where any upgrades available and I was told that I had already been upgraded to deluxe room on groundfloor. Receptionist proceeded to read all my apointments for the next day as my Hotel booking confirmation document was stapled to my appointment sheet and map to find the Hotel. I thought this was rude and when I said "Excuse me but that has nothing to do with my reservation" she continued to read every page. The chap who drives the mini bus made no fuss that I had parked my big high top van behind him as the car park has height restriction. THE ROOM Room had seperate corridor to room with sliding door that was very nice and made the room feel bigger. King size bed, with four pillows (all same) NO complimentary spray etc to help you sleep. Great desk although only two plug sockets. The room was very cold, the heating worked fine but the floor remained incredibly cold, no slippers available. Coffee machine in room with three capsules although neither myself nor my colleague could work out how they worked (NOT NESPRESSO) and when turned on they made a terrible noise as the tray would shake and evrything rattled. Matress was firm although a matress topper would make a world of difference. NO WIFI in room!!! How stupid is that? A cable was provided by reception that just reached the bed so that you can surf in comfort although as the room was so cold this meant untucking the bed and laying sideways. This is not the case at the HI Express next door! Simply cannot understand WHO would make the decision to have NO WIFI??? Bathroom OK - NO ROBE RESTAURANT I had visited this restaurant 7 months ago after staying at the HIE next door, just like then we stood there waiting with nobody around for 10 minutes and then decided just to sit down, on previous visit we simply walked out and went to the 5 Pine tree's down the road. Service was slow bearing in mind at 10pm we where the only people in the restaurant. I requested some balsamic and was given olive oil. Requested wholemeal bread with ham & cheese selection (€20) and was given dry sliced wholemeal that had the bottom crust cut off to get rid of the mould. Bread rolls served where dry & tasteless. Cuttlery was dirty on both courses and glass for my colleagues coke was chipped. Cheese & Ham was fantastic although the lack of decent bread was a real let down. Main course steak & burger all OK. I ordered the best bottle of red on the Menu (Ribera del Duero) also very good. I will not be using the restaurant again. BREAKFAST Stood at entrance waiting 4/5 mins then decided to sit at same table as last night, after selecting some toast etc (no coffe to be seen) I had returned toi buffet to get some orange juice when the server-waiter had returned and was telling my colleague in a loud agressive manner that he could not sit at that table and then repeated "move move move- no sit here" I shouted out "stay where you are, I like that table" This guy then comes steaming up to me and says what is your room number? I said "I do not know, but my key card is on the table" he then said "You cannot sit there" I explained that I had sat there last night and intended to sit there this morning and walked off, feeling that this guy was going to grab me from behind as he was really wound up. We where not offered coffee, neither was the poor chap that entered after us as the waiter hid out the back in the kitchen. Within ten minutes several members of staff walked back and forth giving us dirty looks. We finished our breakfast and was never asked our room numbers. My colleague also discovered that his orange juice glass was chipped! €16 for breakfast that offered; toast, rolls, ham & cheese, cold fried eggs, scrambled eggs (dont go there) chorizo chipolatas (repeated on me all day) frankfurters, various cereals, juices & yoghurts. Breakfast 0/10 I have visited numerous Crowne Plaza Hotels and have always left feeling like I had experienced a fantastic stay, NOT at CP Madrid Airport. When I was leaving the Hotel after breakfast I could not find my apointments sheet that was attached to my reservation sheet. The receptionist had kept it!!! Great property, staff would benefit from working at Crowne Plaza Lumpini Park Bangkok where the service from arrival to departure is flawless and makes you feel welcome. Rate was €60 per room just €5 more than our regular HI Express in Madrid, I would stay again but avoid eating at the Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Value for money”
Reviews.Author: Purav00
Reviews.Content: Great 4 star hotel very close to the airport. Has its own airport shuttle. Clean, modern and free wi-fi. Not for people who want to visit the city center often. Only for people in transit or business. There's nothing around to do. City center is quite far and takes about 25-30 euros by cab. However, for people with time on their hands, they can take the shuttle to the airport and then the airport express bus (24 hours bus) to the city center and it costs only 2 euros per way per person. Staff is extremely helpful and courteous.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel with shuttle to airport”
Reviews.Author: Remlapm
Reviews.Content: Airport is about a 10 minute ride to this hotel barring traffic...no views here, more or less located in the outskirt area of airport, but for an overnighter or two, this is a beautiful hotel. Clean, modern, great lounge, and free wifi in public area of hotel..Staff were so friendly and helpful...Downtown Madrid was about a 20-25 minute taxi ride away...

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel, but not a great location”
Reviews.Author: Jo s
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a conference I was attending at a hotel down the road -- the hotel itself was an excellent place -- very clean, staff was great and overall just a good experience. The only reason I'm giving it a 4 is because the location is not that great -- there are no trains nearby (had to take a cab to stations) so it's hard to get into Madrid and nowhere to walk to (which was ok because there was no sidewalk anyway!). We did eat in the restaurant and it was very good food, but that is the only place to eat that you can walk to. If the area gets more built up, this would be an ideal place to stay -- otherwise, I would only recommend if you need something close to this area for business purposes.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel...Rotten Location”
Reviews.Author: Keith T
Reviews.Content: Overall, my five night stay at the hotel was excellent. The hotel is new, well appointed (if someone what sterile) and staffed by a professional, courteous staff. I found the rooms to be extraordinarily comfortable, clean with excellent beds and towels. The mini fridge was stocked daily with various soft drinks and bottles of water free of charge. There was also an espresso machine in the room that could be used free of charge as well. Internet in the room was free, though not wireless but if you didn't have a wire to connect, the front desk had spares to borrow. Room service was quick and the food was suprisingly good, while the hotel bar was staffed by a group of excellent young bartenders that were friendly and quick to serve a drink, a smile or a kind word. The only issue that I have with the hotel is its location. While close to the airport, there is nothing around the hotel. Literally. I had to take a 17 euro cab ride to the closest store to buy a toothbrush because there is no "gift shop" at the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing wrong, but it's better to stay in the city”
Reviews.Author: LGMA
Reviews.Content: The hotel itself is quite modern and of "normal" Crowne Plaza standard but the location is poor to say the least. The staff is reasonably friendly, but maybe lack of English knowledge makes some conversations difficult and the rooms are fine - clean and of good standard. An executive room has an espresso pod machine and some beverages (non-alcohol) in the fridge. The restaurant dinner is not too expensive but go for something you're sure will be cooked for you, e.g. a burger, instead of heated in the micro (e.g. Paella!). We didn't have breakfast so I cannot comment on that. The location is "in the middle of nowhere". There's a Holiday Inn next door but besides that nothing! It's a deserted industrial area with miles to the nearest restaurant and you don't want to walk there due to traffic and safety. Combined with the 15 minutes taxi ride for €25 - if you cannot manage to arrange the shuttle bus (easier from the hotel than to it) - there are many better located alternatives in down-town Madrid. With the tube station at the airport and approx. 20 min ride to the city there I would rather chose that option.

Reviews.Title: “Good for overnight airport stays”
Reviews.Author: kestep03650
Reviews.Content: This is a new hotel (open just one year) it is next door to the Holiday Inn Express on a development site. The long road that it is off is basically just full of hotels, I think there may be an odd bar/restaurant but not much else. Having said that the hotel do operate a shuttle to the airport and also to the local shopping area at the end of the road where there are restaurants. I think the access to the local train system is there as well so it would be possible to get into the centre without using taxis. The hotel is nicely furnished, good bathrooms, although the beds are very firm but this seems to be the norm for hotels in Madrid; the double glazing is effective and blocks out the majority of aircraft noise (flights start back up at around 6a.m.). We also did not hear any noise from any other guests although there were initially a few people in the bar drinking when we arrived so the hotel was not empty. We didn't eat in the restaurant as we had eaten on the train to Madrid, but the food coming out looked good. We spent the evening in the bar (we didn't mean to stay so long) as the barman was SO FRIENDLY he is a credit to the company. We had a variety of meats and cheeses to try while we enjoyed the excellent wine in the bar/restaurant. The receptionist was also very friendly and helpful. We took the shuttle to the airport which was an experience, a bit bumpy in the back and a few of what looked like near misses but I think this is the way everyone drives in Madrid judging by previous taxi rides we have had. Internet connection is free and wifi available in public areas, we were told we would need a cable to use it in our room but the wifi worked there as well, we had a ground floor room so we assume that it was picking the signal up from the bar area.

Reviews.Title: “Very bad”
Reviews.Author: libertyproject
Reviews.Content: A hotel experience requires some fundaments: safety, cleanliness, good service, comfortable sleeping environment and a good shower. This property offers a nice room and some decent staff folks and that's about it. First, despite emailing and corresponding with this property three times on my desire to reserve a pick up by the airport shuttle, I still had to wait one hour and forty minutes. This time included being hustled by a cab for 55 EURO (my friends paid 75 EURO), having to make a phone call to the property and watching other airport shuttles pass by multiple times AND wait for guest. Next, this property is in the middle of a failed development, probably as a result of the world economy. There is ZERO around except for the Holiday Inn Express across the street. The area is dirty, and since it sit off a highway, it seems even the air quality around here is suspect. Moving on, let's discuss the lack of hot water, which is virtually none. The staff seems nice but since they are so short staffed here, it comes through in the service. All of this leads me to believe one thing: this hotel is barely surviving and are cutting all kinds of corners. I am simply not happy with this property for a multitude of reasons. I find the complete disregard of arriving passengers reckless. Moreover, guests are taking taxis and getting ripped off while the hotel turns a blind eye. Heed my advice, do not stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel but impossible to find”
Reviews.Author: Sandy H
Reviews.Content: Arrived late at night to Madrid airport. No shuttle bus waiting with those from other hotels. No signage about this hotel. No cell phone service. Taxi driver had never heard of the hotel. We drove around for 20 minutes, finally called the hotel and reception directed the driver. 30 Euros later (cause there was no shuttle) we were there. Nice hotel, nice room, brand new, but in the middle of nowhere. Get directions before heading there. Nice shuttle bus took us to the airport the next morning.

Reviews.Title: “Unlike many others in the group - free internet!”
Reviews.Author: Snookoafc1
Reviews.Content: This new hotel got a five-star rating from me because it doesn't rip-off its guests with charges for wi-fi - even in the rooms. All business travelers know that charging for the internet is a downright scandal as it costs hotels nothing. Most hotels in the InterContinental chain - including Holiday Inns and Crowne Plazas - charge, but this one does not. And its staff are super-friendly, so it gets a top thumbs up from me. It is very, very new, right opposite a Holiday Inn Express I have used in the past and at the end of the Madrid Airport runway, but there is barely a whisper in the rooms because the glazing is so good. All of the decor and fittings are top-quality, the rooms super-equipped right down to fluffy towels (instead of threadbare ones). The restaurant menu is limited but good food and the staff are fantastically friendly. They have a shuttle to the airport and even one to the local railway station for a train into the city. This is not a romantic hotel and there is nothing around it of interest, but for the business traveler and the long-distance driver, it is ideal. There is a secure underground car park. The only fault I could find is that there is zero info in the rooms. Nothing to explain where anything is or how to connect, what the TV channels are, restaurant and bar opening times, nothing! But they did have one of those fancy capsule coffee machines in the room - with instructions in Spanish..... But I will forgive anything for the free internet and the excellent staff.

Reviews.Title: “a mess of a stay”
Reviews.Author: nomad462
Reviews.Content: Had a terrible experience here. Can happen anywhere, but something tells me it will take awhile for this hotel to become a good option near MAD. The hotel is far from the airport (unfortunately, it seems to be a general problem with MAD). I contacted the hotel about the shuttle and was scheduled to be picked up at 10 pm. The flight was a bit delayed so I wasn't outside until 10:20 pm or so. I called the hotel and was told to wait for the shuttle. I was not told to wait at a particular spot, so I was waiting at the curb by the bus stops near the arrivals (this area, as the entire airport, is huge). After 50 minute wait I finally saw the shuttle for CP fly by at 50 kph and not even notice me waving my arm like crazy. There may be a special pick up area, but again I had to idea where that was, and wasn't told. Anyway, cab driver had no clue where that is, but eventually (25 euro later) found it. It's almost 11:45 by then and I have to get up for the 4:30 am shuttle. No recognition of my Platinum status, no upgrade of any kind, not particularly friendly staff, but fine. Have dealt with worse. The room was perfectly clean and comfortable. I decided to check email, to find that I need a wifi code from the front desk. Pick up the phone and ... nothing! The phone is not even on. My foot is sprained, so I am not about to hobble downstairs for it. The shuttle in the morning was on time and took me to the airport. This is the last time I'll use this place again. But I hope others have had better experiences here.

Reviews.Title: “Brand new airport hotel”
Reviews.Author: happyHongKong
Reviews.Content: Spacious room, everything brand new. Airport shuttle not frequent, but can make bookings at the reception to ensure timely pick up/ drop off. No wifi in rooms so ask for a cable at the reception. All rooms facing away from streets with excellent sound proofing, hence it is quiet to give you a good night's sleep

Reviews.Title: “excellent customer service”
Reviews.Author: riverhouse619
Reviews.Content: I would recommend this hotel to any Americans who is traveling in Spain and wants to stay near the airport for its customer service. The room is very 4 star with coffee machine and other amenities that goes into any Americans 4 start Hotel. The restaurant food is not bad also.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Stay”
Reviews.Author: USAFRetTraveler
Reviews.Content: Very Clean, friendly staff would stay again there.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Stay but only good for business travellers”
Reviews.Author: Maheshkhanolkar
Reviews.Content: This in 4-5star cateogary of Intercontinental group hotels. It is very much new. The hotel is excellent to stay. Very neat & clean. Rooms were surpisingly spacious. I feel as if I was in a suite room. This hotel in the newly developing commercial complex. It is near to the Airport but far away from the city. (Taxi one way may cost about Euros 50-60). There is a restaurant but still not fully functional hence you have very limited choice of food. Staff was extremely friendly & helpful. Breackfast served was limited continental. After the hotel is fully functional all shortfalls will be managed but overall excellent Hotel. More suitabel for frequent business travellers who wants to stay near airport to early mrning & late night flights. Family travellers may stay for good quality & peaceful stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great service and nice staff”
Reviews.Author: catman52
Reviews.Content: When visiting the Madrid Ifema expo center a great place to stay, free shuttle service both ways and very good and attentive staff. Some minor problems at this brand new place, AC problems .but handled well.Warm water flow not regular. But price / quality OK

Reviews.Title: “Brand New But Half-baked”
Reviews.Author: Highpocketsagain
Reviews.Content: Your choice for breakfast is: salami or toast !? My husband had to practically beg for a second cup of coffee. No other restaurants in the area so you're stuck! Nice furniture but no accents: no pictures on the wall, no plants, nothing else in the room. My husband waited 15 minutes for the bartender to stick his head out and see he had a customer. There seems to be very limited staff. Only positive: the bed sleeps good, the building smells new.

Reviews.Title: “Again - Airport hotel ????”
Reviews.Author: garyinternational
Reviews.Content: Is a hotel considered an airport hotel when they have only 4 shuttle services in a day? Nice and new hotel but with a number of serious problems: 1. Only 4 shuttle rides a day (Taxi's are 25 Euro) 2. Staff do not speak or understand English (i had a lot of communcation problems) - the idea is if you stay in an international chain, people should at least speak english. 3. Breakfast was abomnable - congealed cold eggs, vertially no choice of food at all. very stingy and poor. 4. No lobby lounge so no place to sit with colleagues. But its a new hotel, very clean but not an Airport Hotel

Reviews.Title: “silence”
Reviews.Author: Lankylee
Reviews.Content: Very new and some rough edges but it is excellent. Silent,soacious and functional rooms,

HotelInfo.Name: Crowne Plaza Madrid Airport
